member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.AlphaComponentPosition
member.summary: Defines the position of a color's alpha component relative to all other components.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.AlphaComponentPosition.Leading
member.summary: The alpha component occurs before all other components.
member.remarks: For example, this may indicate the #AARRGGBB or ARGB format which is the default format for XAML itself and the Color struct.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.AlphaComponentPosition.Trailing
member.summary: The alpha component occurs after all other components.
member.remarks: For example, this may indicate the #RRGGBBAA or RGBA format which is the default format for CSS.

member.remarks: HSV color information is intentionally not provided. Use to obtain it.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.FlatColorPalette

member.remarks:
See: - https://htmlcolorcodes.com/color-chart/ - https://htmlcolorcodes.com/color-chart/flat-design-color-chart/ - http://designmodo.github.io/Flat-UI/
The GitHub project is licensed as MIT: https://github.com/designmodo/Flat-UI.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.FluentColorPalette
member.summary: Implements the standard Windows 10 color palette.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.FluentColorPalette.ColorCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of colors in this palette. A color is not necessarily a single value and may be composed of several shades. This has little meaning in this palette as colors are not strictly separated.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.FluentColorPalette.ShadeCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of shades for each color in this palette. Shades are usually a variation of the color lightening or darkening it. This has little meaning in this palette as colors are not strictly separated by shade.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.IColorPalette
member.summary: Interface to define a color palette.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.IColorPalette.ColorCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of colors in this palette. A color is not necessarily a single value and may be composed of several shades.
member.remarks: Represents total columns in a table.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.IColorPalette.ShadeCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of shades for each color in this palette. Shades are usually a variation of the color lightening or darkening it.
member.remarks: Represents total rows in a table.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.IColorPalette.GetColor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a color in the palette by index.
member.param: The index of the color in the palette. The index must be between zero and .
The index of the color shade in the palette. The index must be between zero and .
member.returns: The color at the specified index or an exception.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.MaterialColorPalette
member.summary: Implements a reduced version of the 2014 Material Design color palette.
member.remarks:
This palette is based on the one outlined here:
https://material.io/design/color/the-color-system.html#tools-for-picking-colors
In order to make the palette uniform and rectangular the following alterations were made:
1. The A100-A700 shades of each color are excluded. These shades do not exist for all colors (brown/gray). 2. Black/White are stand-alone and are also excluded.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.MaterialColorPalette.MaterialColor
member.summary: Defines all colors in the .
member.remarks: This is done in an enum to ensure it is compiled into the assembly improving startup performance.

member.summary: Initializes all color chart colors.

member.summary: Implements half of the for improved usability.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSlider.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected color in the RGB color model.
member.remarks: Use this property instead of when in to avoid loss of precision and color drifting.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSlider.ColorComponent
member.summary: Gets or sets the color component represented by the slider.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSlider.ColorModel
member.summary: Gets or sets the active color model used by the slider.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSlider.HsvColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected color in the HSV color model.
member.remarks: Use this property instead of when in to avoid loss of precision and color drifting.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSlider.IsAlphaVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the alpha component is visible and rendered. When false, this ensures that the gradient is always visible and never transparent regardless of the actual color. This property is ignored when the alpha component itself is being displayed.
member.remarks: Setting to false means the alpha component is always forced to maximum for components other than during rendering. This doesn't change the value of the alpha component in the color – it is only for display.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSlider.IsPerceptive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the slider adapts rendering to improve user-perception over exactness.
member.remarks:
When true in the HSVA color model, this ensures that the gradient is always visible and never washed out regardless of the actual color. When true in the RGBA color model, this ensures the gradient always appears as red, green or blue.
For example, with Hue in the HSVA color model, the Saturation and Value components are always forced to maximum values during rendering. In the RGBA color model, all components other than are forced to minimum values during rendering.
Note this property will only adjust components other than during rendering. This also doesn't change the values of any components in the actual color – it is only for display.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSlider.IsRoundingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether rounding of color component values is enabled.
member.remarks: This is applicable for the HSV color model only. The struct uses double values while the struct uses byte. Only double types need rounding.

member.summary: Gets or sets the two HSV color components displayed by the spectrum.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.HsvColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected color in the HSV color model.
member.remarks: This should be used in all cases instead of the property. Internally, the uses the HSV color model and using this property will avoid loss of precision and color drifting.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.MaxHue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value of the Hue component in the range from 0..359. This property must be greater than .
member.remarks: Internally, the uses the HSV color model.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.MaxSaturation
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value of the Saturation component in the range from 0..100. This property must be greater than .
member.remarks: Internally, the uses the HSV color model.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value of the Value component in the range from 0..100. This property must be greater than .
member.remarks: Internally, the uses the HSV color model.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.MinHue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value of the Hue component in the range from 0..359. This property must be less than .
member.remarks: Internally, the uses the HSV color model.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.MinSaturation
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value of the Saturation component in the range from 0..100. This property must be less than .
member.remarks: Internally, the uses the HSV color model.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.MinValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value of the Value component in the range from 0..100. This property must be less than .

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets the displayed shape of the spectrum.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorSpectrum.ThirdComponent
member.summary: Gets the third HSV color component that is NOT displayed by the spectrum. This is automatically calculated from the property.
member.remarks: This property should be used for any external color slider that represents the third component of the color. Note that this property uses the generic type instead of the more accurate to allow direct usage by the generalized color sliders.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Converters.AccentColorConverter
member.summary: Creates an accent color for a given base color value and step parameter.
member.remarks: This is a highly-specialized converter for the color picker.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Converters.AccentColorConverter.ValueDelta
member.summary: The amount to change the Value component for each accent color step.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Converters.AccentColorConverter.GetAccent(Avalonia.Media.HsvColor,System.Int32)
member.summary: This does not account for perceptual differences and also does not match with system accent color calculation.
member.remarks: Use the HSV representation as it's more perceptual. In most cases only the value is changed by a fixed percentage so the algorithm is reproducible.
member.param: The base color to calculate the accent from.
The number of accent color steps to move.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Converters.ContrastBrushConverter
member.summary: Gets a , either black or white, depending on the luminance of the supplied color. A default color supplied in the converter parameter may be returned if alpha is below the set threshold.
member.remarks: This is a highly-specialized converter for the color picker.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Converters.ContrastBrushConverter.AlphaThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha channel threshold below which a default color is used instead of black/white.

member.summary: Gets the relative (perceptual) luminance/brightness of the given color. 1 is closer to white while 0 is closer to black.

member.returns: The relative (perceptual) luminance/brightness of the given color.

member.remarks: Only English names are currently supported following known color names. In the future known color names could be localized.

member.returns: The human-readable display name for the given .

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorPickerHelpers
member.summary: Contains internal, special-purpose helpers used with the color picker.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorPickerHelpers.CreateComponentBitmapAsync(Avalonia.Collections.Pooled.PooledList{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Int32,Avalonia.Layout.Orientation,Avalonia.Controls.ColorModel,Avalonia.Controls.ColorComponent,Avalonia.Media.HsvColor,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates a new bitmap of the specified size by changing a specific color component. This will produce a gradient representing a sweep of all possible values of the color component.
member.param: The target buffer which will contain the bitmap data on return.
The pixel width (X, horizontal) of the resulting bitmap.
The pixel height (Y, vertical) of the resulting bitmap.
The orientation of the resulting bitmap (gradient direction).
The color model being used: RGBA or HSVA.
The specific color component to sweep.
The base HSV color used for components not being changed.
Whether the alpha component is visible and rendered in the bitmap. This property is ignored when the alpha component itself is being rendered.
Whether the slider adapts rendering to improve user-perception over exactness. This will ensure colors are always discernible.
member.returns: A new bitmap representing a gradient of color component values.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.ColorPickerHelpers.CreateBitmapFromPixelData(Avalonia.Collections.Pooled.PooledList{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the given raw BGRA pre-multiplied alpha pixel data into a bitmap.
member.param: The bitmap (in raw BGRA pre-multiplied alpha pixels).
The pixel width of the bitmap.
The pixel height of the bitmap.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Hsv
member.summary: Contains and allows modification of Hue, Saturation and Value components.
member.remarks:
The is a specialized struct optimized for performance and memory:
This is not a read-only struct like and allows editing the fields
Removes the alpha component unnecessary in core calculations
No component bounds checks or clamping is done.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Hsv.H
member.summary: The Hue component in the range from 0..359.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Hsv.S
member.summary: The Saturation component in the range from 0..1.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Hsv.V
member.summary: The Value component in the range from 0..1.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: The Hue component in the range from 0..360.
The Saturation component in the range from 0..1.
The Value component in the range from 0..1.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: An existing to convert to .

member.summary: Converts this struct into a standard .

member.summary: Defines a relative amount that a color component should be incremented.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.IncrementAmount.Small
member.summary: A smaller change in value.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.IncrementAmount.Large
member.summary: A larger change in value.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.IncrementDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction a color component should be incremented.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.IncrementDirection.Lower
member.summary: Decreasing in value towards zero.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.IncrementDirection.Higher
member.summary: Increasing in value towards positive infinity.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Rgb
member.summary: Contains and allows modification of Red, Green and Blue components.
member.remarks:
The is a specialized struct optimized for performance and memory:
This is not a read-only struct like and allows editing the fields
Removes the alpha component unnecessary in core calculations
Normalizes RGB components in the range of 0..1 to simplify calculations.
No component bounds checks or clamping is done.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Rgb.R
member.summary: The Red component in the range from 0..1.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Rgb.G
member.summary: The Green component in the range from 0..1.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Rgb.B
member.summary: The Blue component in the range from 0..1.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Rgb.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: The Red component in the range from 0..1.

The Blue component in the range from 0..1.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Primitives.Rgb.ToHsv

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumComponents
member.summary: Defines the two HSV color components displayed by a .
member.remarks: Order of the color components is important and correspond with an X/Y axis in Box shape or a degree/radius in Ring shape.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumComponents.HueValue
member.summary: The Hue and Value components.
member.remarks: In Box shape, Hue is mapped to the X-axis and Value is mapped to the Y-axis. In Ring shape, Hue is mapped to degrees and Value is mapped to radius.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumComponents.ValueHue
member.summary: The Value and Hue components.
member.remarks: In Box shape, Value is mapped to the X-axis and Hue is mapped to the Y-axis. In Ring shape, Value is mapped to degrees and Hue is mapped to radius.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumComponents.HueSaturation
member.summary: The Hue and Saturation components.
member.remarks: In Box shape, Hue is mapped to the X-axis and Saturation is mapped to the Y-axis. In Ring shape, Hue is mapped to degrees and Saturation is mapped to radius.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumComponents.SaturationHue
member.summary: The Saturation and Hue components.
member.remarks: In Box shape, Saturation is mapped to the X-axis and Hue is mapped to the Y-axis. In Ring shape, Saturation is mapped to degrees and Hue is mapped to radius.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumComponents.SaturationValue
member.summary: The Saturation and Value components.
member.remarks: In Box shape, Saturation is mapped to the X-axis and Value is mapped to the Y-axis. In Ring shape, Saturation is mapped to degrees and Value is mapped to radius.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumComponents.ValueSaturation
member.summary: The Value and Saturation components.
member.remarks: In Box shape, Value is mapped to the X-axis and Saturation is mapped to the Y-axis. In Ring shape, Value is mapped to degrees and Saturation is mapped to radius.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumShape
member.summary: Defines the shape of a .

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumShape.Box
member.summary: The spectrum is in the shape of a rectangular or square box. Note that more colors are visible to the user in Box shape.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorSpectrumShape.Ring
member.summary: The spectrum is in the shape of an ellipse or circle.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView
member.summary: Presents a color for user editing using a spectrum, palette and component sliders.

member.name: E:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.ColorChanged
member.summary: Event for when the selected color changes within the slider.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.GetColorFromHexTextBox
member.summary: Gets the value of the hex TextBox and sets it as the current . If invalid, the TextBox hex text will revert back to the last valid color.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.SetColorToHexTextBox
member.summary: Sets the current to the hex TextBox.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.ValidateSelection
member.summary: Validates the tab/panel/page selection taking into account the visibility of each item as well as the current selection.
member.remarks: Derived controls may re-implement this based on their default style / control template and any specialized selection needs.

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.ColorModel
member.remarks: This property is only applicable to the components tab. The spectrum tab must always be in HSV and the palette tab contains only pre-defined colors.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.HexInputAlphaPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the alpha component in the hexadecimal input box relative to all other color components.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsAlphaEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the alpha component is enabled. When disabled (set to false) the alpha component will be fixed to maximum and editing controls disabled.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsAlphaVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the alpha component editing controls (Slider(s) and TextBox) are visible. When hidden, the existing alpha component value is maintained.
member.remarks: Note that also controls the alpha component TextBox visibility.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsColorComponentsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the color components tab/panel/page (subview) is visible.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsColorModelVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the active color model indicator/selector is visible.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsColorPaletteVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the color palette tab/panel/page (subview) is visible.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsColorPreviewVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the color preview is visible.
member.remarks: Note that accent color visibility is controlled separately by .

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsColorSpectrumVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the color spectrum tab/panel/page (subview) is visible.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsColorSpectrumSliderVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the color spectrum's third component slider is visible.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsComponentSliderVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether color component sliders are visible.
member.remarks: All color components are controlled by this property but alpha can also be controlled with .

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsComponentTextInputVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether color component text inputs are visible.
member.remarks: All color components are controlled by this property but alpha can also be controlled with .

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.IsHexInputVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the hexadecimal color value text input is visible.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.PaletteColors
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of individual colors in the palette.
member.remarks:
This is not commonly set manually. Instead, it should be set automatically by providing an to the property.
Also note that this property is what should be bound in the control template. is too high-level to use on its own.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.PaletteColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of colors in each row (section) of the color palette. Within a standard palette, rows are shades and columns are colors.
member.remarks:
This is not commonly set manually. Instead, it should be set automatically by providing an to the property.
Also note that this property is what should be bound in the control template. is too high-level to use on its own.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.Palette
member.summary: Gets or sets the color palette.
member.remarks: This will automatically set both and overwriting any existing values.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.ColorView.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected tab/panel/page (subview).
member.remarks: When using the default control theme, this property is designed to be used with the enum. The enum defines the index values of each of the three standard tabs. Use like `SelectedIndex = (int)ColorViewTab.Palette`.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.ColorViewTab
member.summary: Defines a specific tab/page (subview) within the .
member.remarks: This is indexed to match the default control template ordering.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorViewTab.Spectrum
member.summary: The color spectrum subview with a box/ring spectrum and sliders.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorViewTab.Palette
member.summary: The color palette subview with a grid of selectable colors.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Controls.ColorViewTab.Components
member.summary: The components subview with sliders and numeric input boxes.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ColorToDisplayNameConverter
member.summary: Gets the approximated display name for the color.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ColorToHexConverter
member.summary: Converts a color to a hex string and vice versa.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ColorToHexConverter.IsAlphaVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the alpha component is visible in the Hex formatted text.
member.remarks:
When hidden the existing alpha component value is maintained. Also when hidden the user is still able to input an 8-digit number with alpha. Alpha will be processed but then removed when displayed.
Because this property only controls whether alpha is displayed (and it is still processed regardless) it is termed 'Visible' instead of 'Enabled'.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ColorToHexConverter.AlphaPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of a color's alpha component relative to all other components.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ColorToHexConverter.ToHexString(Avalonia.Media.Color,Avalonia.Controls.AlphaComponentPosition,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the given color to its hex color value string representation.
member.param: The color to represent as a hex value string.
The output position of the alpha component.
Whether the alpha component will be included in the hex string.
Whether the hex symbol '#' will be added.
member.returns: The input color converted to its hex value string.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ColorToHexConverter.ParseHexString(System.String,Avalonia.Controls.AlphaComponentPosition)
member.summary: Parses a hex color value string into a new .
member.param: The hex color string to parse.
The input position of the alpha component.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ColorToHexConverter.TryParseHexFormat(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},Avalonia.Controls.AlphaComponentPosition,Avalonia.Media.Color@)
member.summary: Parses the given span of characters representing a hex color value into a new .
member.remarks: This is based on the Color.TryParseHexFormat() method. It is copied because it needs to be extended to handle alpha position. However, the alpha position enum is only available in the controls namespace with the ColorPicker control.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.DoNothingForNullConverter
member.summary: Converter that will do nothing (not update bound values) when a null value is encountered. This converter enables binding nullable with non-nullable properties in some scenarios.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ToBrushConverter
member.summary: Converts the given value into an when a conversion is possible.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Controls.Converters.ToColorConverter
member.summary: Converts the given value into a when a conversion is possible.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with a field or property member.
member.param: The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the list of field and property members.
member.param: The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values when returning with the specified return value condition.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and a field or property member.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and list of field and property members.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.
